com.bazaarvoice
Class DisplayParams

java.lang.Object
  com.bazaarvoice.BazaarParams
      com.bazaarvoice.DisplayParams

public class DisplayParams
extends BazaarParams

Handles the parameters for a display request.
Use of this class will rely on knowledge of the Bazaarvoice API. You should use this site as a reference for which parameters to pass using this class.

Created on 7/9/12. Copyright (c) 2012 BazaarVoice. All rights reserved.

Author:
Bazaarvoice Engineering

Method Detail

getSearch

public java.lang.String getSearch()
Get the search term

Returns:
a list of terms

setSearch

public void setSearch(java.lang.String search)
Set the search term to query. This is an "or" search. For example, when querying for products with the search term "Electric Dryer," the result returns products that have both "Electric" and "Dryer" in the Product Name or Product Description.

Parameters:
search - the earch terms

getLocale

public java.lang.String getLocale()
Get the "Locale" parameter if it has been set.

Returns:
the locale

setLocale

public void setLocale(java.lang.String locale)
Locale to display Labels, Configuration, Product Attributes and Category Attributes in. The default value is the locale defined in the display associated with the API key. If specified, the locale value is also used as the default ContentLocale filter value.

Parameters:
locale - the locale

public void setOffset(int offset)
Changes the index at which to begin returning results. Useful for paging, for instance.

Parameters:
offset - new offset

getExcludeFamily

public java.lang.Boolean getExcludeFamily()
Get the excludeFamily parameter

Returns:
excludeFamily parameter

setExcludeFamily

public void setExcludeFamily(java.lang.Boolean excludeFamily)
Boolean flag indicating whether to exclude content (reviews, questions, etc.) from other products in the same family as the requested product. This setting only affects any nested content that is returned. For example, "&filter=productid:eq:1101&include=reviews&excludeFamily=true" limits returned review content to just that of product 1101 and not any of the products in the same family. If a value is not defined, content on all products in the family is returned.

Parameters:
offset - new offset

addInclude

public void addInclude(IncludeType type)
Related subjects to be included (e.g. Products, Categories, Authors, Reviews...).

Parameters:
type - the type to include

addAttribute

public void addAttribute(java.lang.String attribute)
Attributes to be included when returning content. For example, if includes are requested along with the ModeratorCodes attribute, both the includes and the results will contain moderator codes. In order to filter by ModeratorCode, you must request the ModeratorCodes attribute parameter.

Parameters:
attribute - the new attribute

addSort

public void addSort(java.lang.String attribute,
                    boolean asc)
Add an attribute to the "Sort" parameter list. Sorts by the schema of the given attribute.

Parameters:
attribute - the attribute name
asc - true for ascending, false for descending

addStats

public void addStats(IncludeStatsType type)
Add a content type to the "Stats" parameter. Retrieves statistics for that type of content along with the response.

Parameters:
type - the type of content for which to add stats

addSearchOnIncludedType

public void addSearchOnIncludedType(IncludeType type,
                                    java.lang.String searchString)
Search query for included content. This is an "or" search and must include a type. For example, when querying included products with the search term "Electric Dryer," the result returns products that have both "Electric" and "Dryer" in the Product Name or Product Description.

Note: Be sure to remove any leading or trailing white space as it could interfere with search performance.

Parameters:
type - the type to search: comments, reviews, etc
searchString - the string to search for

addSortOnIncludedType

public void addSortOnIncludedType(IncludeType type,
                                  java.lang.String attribute,
                                  boolean asc)
Add a "Sort_[TYPE]" parameter to the request. Sorts any included content of the provided type by the schema of the given attribute.

Parameters:
type - the type to sort: comments, reviews, etc
attribute - the attribute name
asc - true for ascending, false for descending

addLimitOnIncludedType

public void addLimitOnIncludedType(IncludeType type,
                                   int limitVal)
Add a "Limit_[TYPE]" parameter to the request. Limits any included content of the provided type to a maximum amount.

Parameters:
type - the type to limit: comments, reviews, etc
limitVal - the number to limit

addFilter

public void addFilter(java.lang.String attribute,
                      Equality equality,
                      java.lang.String value)
Filter criteria for primary content of the query.

Parameters:
attribute - what to filter on, i.e. Rating or ProductId
equality - comparison for filtering, greater than, equals etc
value - the value for the filter

addFilter

public void addFilter(java.lang.String attribute,
                      Equality equality,
                      java.lang.String[] values)
Filter criteria for primary content of the query. Allows multiple values.

Parameters:
attribute - what to filter on, i.e. Rating or ProductId
equality - comparison for filtering, greater than, equals etc
values - the values for the filter

addFilterOnIncludedType

public void addFilterOnIncludedType(IncludeType filterType,
                                    java.lang.String attribute,
                                    Equality equality,
                                    java.lang.String value)
Add a "Filter_[TYPE]" parameter to the request. Filters any included content by the schema of the given attribute, Equality type, and value.

Parameters:
filterType - the type to filter, i.e. Comments for Reviews. If null this is a regular filter
attribute - what to filter on, i.e. Rating or ProductId
equality - comparison for filtering, greater than, equals etc
value - the value for the filter

addFilterOnIncludedType

public void addFilterOnIncludedType(IncludeType filterType,
                                    java.lang.String attribute,
                                    Equality equality,
                                    java.lang.String[] values)
Add a "Filter_[TYPE]" parameter to the request. Filters any included content by the schema of the given attribute, Equality type, and values.

Allows multiple values.

Parameters:
filterType - the type to filter, i.e. Comments for Reviews.
attribute - what to filter on, i.e. Rating or ProductId
equality - comparison for filtering, greater than, equals etc
values - the values for the filter
